intro: Cuphea purpurascens, commonly known as the crimson flame plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators. Cuphea purpurascens is relatively easy to grow and prefers well-drained soil.
